item.title: Furniture, boxes and other materials dumped in street, 8th December
item.description:
This has been left in the street for over a month now, and despite reporting, it hasn't been cleaned. Street cleaners have been round and ignored it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Redcross Way, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No full street sweeping for many weeks, 8th December
item.description:
The pavements on the section of Camberwell Grove north of the railway bridge are choked with rotting leaf litter. There has not been a complete/total sweeping of leaves at all so far this autumn. There are many very large trees in this street, and massive leaf fall. Parts of the pavements themselves are swept and then the operative leaves and doens;t come back to finish the job. Consequently the gutters are completely choked with the rotting leaves. This is dangerous because the pavements has become slippery, and you can't see the kerbs in many places, also a hazard. When it rains heavily the water backs up across the road (we are on a hill). I'm watching the operative right now and he's sweeping up some of the leaves on the pavement, BUT SWEEPING THE REST INTO THE RAIN GUTTERS AN WALKING ON! This is only adding to the heaps of leaves already there. This is not a job for one person who comes occasionally, but needs a 'blitz' with a team to do the whole job. NB The same applies to all the streets in this neighbourhood.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, Camberwell Grove, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lack of Street sweeping and litter bins full Blackfen Parade, 8th December
item.description:
There appears to be little or a poor standard of street cleaning along Blackfen Parade Blacken with some litter bins over full/unemployed when I visited the shopping area this morning 8.12.25. Please can this be rectified as it makes the area untidy giving a shabby appearance which makes the area uninviting . This is not a good image for local businesses and keeping the shopping area alive. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Blackfen Road, Blackfen, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Muddy slippery footpath all along the river walk, 8th December
item.description:
The river footpaths from the swing park all the way along the rivers loop to Main Rd is very muddy under foot and slippery to walk on in the winter months and so needs some grit or gravel placed on the path please before an elder person or child slips over in the mud and hurts themselves. We have a lot of elderly dog walkers and children going into the park every day so it’s a well used footpath.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Way, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
